definition: lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Her sight is equal to threading a needle without glasses.
sentences.chinese: 她的視力很好，能不戴眼鏡穿針引線。

sentences.english: The Science and Technology Association served the function of a go-between.
sentences.chinese: 科學技術協會發揮了穿針引線的作用。

sentences.english: Threading ga needle is an art in itself.
sentences.chinese: 穿針引線本身就是一種技巧。

sentences.english: Diane's role was to introduce the piece.
sentences.chinese: 黛安充當的是穿針引線的角色。

sentences.english: She frowns when she's putting thread into a needle.
sentences.chinese: 她穿針引線時，總是眯眼蹙額。

sentences.english: Threading a needle is an art in itself .
sentences.chinese: 穿針引線本身就是一種技巧。

sentences.english: This afternoon, sunshine in my tranquil emptiness threads.
sentences.chinese: 這個下午，陽光在我安靜的空空蕩蕩中，穿針引線。

sentences.english: My grandmother can't easily thread the needle.
sentences.chinese: 穿針引線對我祖母來說可不容易。

definition: to spare no effort
to set a trap
to be determined to win (idiom)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to charge and break through enemy lines
trusted lieutenant
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
to deceive/to conceal
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to raise money
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to compete for first prize
